did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Virginia Federation of Business and Professional Women's Clubs records, 1921-2009
did.physdesc: 5.15 cu. ft. (15 boxes and oversize banner on shelf)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Federation of Business and Professional Women's Clubs. Records, 1921-2009. Accession 44419. Organization records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Virginia Federation of Business and Professional Women's Clubs, July 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The National Business and Professional Women's Club held it's first convention in St. Louis in July 1919 and elected Gail Laughlin as the first president. Virginia was one of the earliest State Federations to affiliate with the National Federation of Business and Professional Women's Clubs. In 1919, Dr. Orie Latham Hatcher, Cornelia Adair, Mrs. Geline MacDonald Bowman, Ella Agnew, Katherine Hawes, and Mrs. Beverly B. Munford called the meeting at which the Virginia Federation was formed with the clubs of Richmond, Roanoke, Lynchburg and Danville as it's charter members. Miss Ella Agnew was the first president of the Virginia Federation, serving 1919 to 1920. In 2009, due to declining membership the Virginia Federation dissolved.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 1921-2009, of the Virginia chapter of the Business and Professional Women, including annual reports, bylaws, correspondence, histories, minutes, newsletters, photographs, programs, and reports. Included are copies of the newsletter, Federation Notes, 1969-2009; minutes; convention photographs, 1929-2000; annual convention programs, 1926-2009; histories of the organization and presidents; membership finances and rosters, 1996-2007; bylaws, certificates of incorporation, and rules handbooks; and emblems and organizational prayer. Similar materials, such as annual reports, can be found in several folders throughout the collection, therefore a thorough cross checking of all folders is necessary to find related materials.

The chronological files, 1968-2009, mainly contain minutes but also included are annual reports, bylaws, correspondence, finances, memoranda, memorial service programs, photographs, and reports. Of note is the correspondence detailing the closure of various chapters of the organization starting in 1999 and the dissolution of the Virginia chapter of the BPW in 2009. These files contain information on the day to day activities of the organization and works accomplished.

Of note are the files for each president of the chapter from 1919 to 1980. Included are annual reports, clippings, convention programs, correspondence, finances, biographies of the presidents, photographs, reports, and resolutions. Also of note are the photographs. 1929-2002, of annual conventions and presidents (found in the President's files). Also included are copies of A History of the National Federation of Business and Professional Women's Clubs, Inc., Volumes I-III.

did.unittitle: Bylaws, policies and standing rules handbook 2002.
History book, 75th Anniversary Virginia Federation of BPW, 1994.
A History of the National Federation of Business and Professional Women's Clubs, Inc., Volume I, 1919-1944.
A History of the National Federation of Business and Professional Women's Clubs, Inc., Volume II, 1944-1960.
A History of the National Federation of Business and Professional Women's Clubs, Inc., Volume III, 1960-1994.
Newsletters, The Virginia Business & Professional Woman, 1947-1948.
President's Files, Profiles Thru The Years, 1919-1945.
President's Files, Profiles Thru The Years, 1945-1992.
President's Files, Nina B. Horton Avery, 1942-1944.
President's Files, Judge Irene L. Pancoast, 1947-1949.
Programs, Fall board meeting and leadership conferences, 1980-1993.
Programs, Various awards, banquets, and state conventions, 1969-2009.
Virginia Military Institute, Supreme Court decision, 1991-1996.
Virginia Military Institute, Supreme Court decision, clippings, 1991-1996.
Photographs, Karen Keesling Assistant Secretary Air Force, 1988.

scopecontent.p: Includes scrapbooks, 1965 and 1969; oversize panoramic photographs of state conventions, 1929, 1933, and ca. 1940; and a group photograph on a wooden frame, 1973. Ephemera includes buttons and a VBPW seal embosser.

did.unittitle: Banner of the BPW, Virginia Federation, nd.
